hours_text:
# Campus Tours 

## Step Onto Campus, Step Into Your Future

Every year, thousands of Coyotes achieve their goals at Cal State San Bernardino—and for many, it all starts with a campus visit. Touring CSUSB gives you the chance to picture yourself here, explore our classrooms and labs, and experience the supportive community that will help you define your future.

At CSUSB, you’ll discover a university that’s affordable, welcoming, and dedicated to preparing you for life and career success.

## Schedule a Campus Tour

There’s no better way to picture your future than by experiencing CSUSB firsthand. Join us for an in-person or virtual tour of our welcoming, diverse campus community. Each tour is led by a Coyote Ambassador—a current student who will share their own experiences with academics, campus life, and what it’s really like to be part of the Pack.

[ In-Person Tours  ](https://csusb.event451.sites.451.io/event/798864)

[ Group Tours  ](https://csusb.event451.sites.451.io/event/800141)

### Discover CSUSB – Virtual Tours

Can’t make it in person? No problem. Take a 360-degree virtual tour to explore various colleges, the Student Recreation and Wellness Center, Coyote Commons, Pfau Library, the Santos Manuel Student Union, and the Murillo Family Observatory, among other stops. 

[Launch Experience](https://www.youvisit.com/#/vte/?data-platform=v&data-link-type=immersive&data-inst=60140&data-image-width=100%&data-image-height=100%&)

### Housing and Palm Desert Campus Tours

admission_text:
# RAFFMA

Admission is free for all visitors! 

[Check In Here](https://csusb.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0cDdA4HVwYyJ1bg)

Contemporary Galleries Closed

[Hours, Parking, and Directions](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/visit-us/hours-parking-directions)

To view our Egyptian gallery, please schedule an appointment by calling the front desk at (909) 537-7689 or emailing us at [raffma@csusb.edu](mailto:raffma@csusb.edu). Thank you, and we look forward to seeing you at the museum.

[ The Beauty of Becoming  ](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/art-exhibitions-events/events/beauty-becoming)

## *RAFFMA is open every second Saturday of the month!

## [Current Exhibits](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/art-exhibitions-events)

[View Previous Exhibitions](https://www.csusb.edu/node/511728)

[ Teacher Resources  ](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/virtual-resources/teacher-resources)

[ Plan A Tour  ](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/visit-us/plan-tour)

Need a hand getting here? We've got your back!

[Hours, Parking, and Directions](https://www.csusb.edu/raffma/visit-us/hours-parking-directions)

## About Us

The Robert and Frances Fullerton Museum of Art opened its doors to the public in the fall of 1996. Since then, it has grown to be one of the major cultural centers in the region.

We have hosted many exhibitions from artists all o...
accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

We want to be accessible to all visitors and ensure a positive RAFFMA experience to the best of our ability. Our museum is ADA-compliant. If you require any information, please contact us at 

(909) 537 - 7689

[raffma@csusb.edu](mailto:raffma@csusb.edu)

[CSUSB Accessibility Areas](https://map.csusb.edu/?id=1850#!ct/78171,48439,49656,49657,49669,56974?s/)

## Accessible Parking and Drop Off

**Parking**

Accessibility parking is available in Lot M, adjacent to the RAFFMA parking slots. CSUSB does offer free accessibility parking - please see RAFFMA front desk for assistance. Please have your placard number ready. 

**Drop Off**

The safest and most convenient location to drop off a guest with limited mobility is the curbside drop-off area in Lot M, located in front of the Visual Arts Building. 

## Museum Seating

  * There are some seats in select galleries, special exhibitions, and lobby areas.
  * Most of our seating is benches and foldable chairs.

## Restrooms

**VA 104**

Restrooms and water fountains are located in the Visual Arts Center. Please ask for directions at the museum front desk.

## Service Animals

  * Service and assistance animals are welcome at RAFFMA.
  * Your service or support animal should remain by your side throughout your visit and ideally should be identifiable as working and remain on a leash.
  * If your service or support animal is not a dog, please contact our team at [raffma@csusb.edu](mailto:raffma@csusb.edu) prior to your...
